com.bmwcarit.barefoot.util

Class AbstractServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmwcarit.barefoot.util.AbstractServer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatcherServer, TrackerServer

    public class AbstractServer
extends Object
    Abstract server implementation for hosting a service that can be accessed via TCP/IP socket.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractServer.ResponseFactory
      Abstract factory for generation of a AbstractServer.ResponseHandler object for each request message.
      protected static class  AbstractServer.ResponseHandler
      Abstract response handler that processes request messages and generates response messages.
      static class  AbstractServer.RESULT
      Result types of AbstractServer.ResponseHandler objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractServer(Properties serverProperties, AbstractServer.ResponseFactory responseFactory)
      Creates a AbstractServer object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractServer

        public AbstractServer(Properties serverProperties,
                      AbstractServer.ResponseFactory responseFactory)
        Creates a AbstractServer object. It expects the following properties:
        • server.port (optional, default: 1234)
        • server.time.request (milliseconds, optional, default: 15000)
        • server.time.response (milliseconds, optional, default: 60000)
        • server.connections (optional, default: 20)
        Parameters:
        serverProperties - Properties object containing all necessary server settings.
        responseFactory - AbstractServer.ResponseFactory object that generates a AbstractServer.ResponseHandler for each request message which, in turn, processes requests and creates response messages.

    • Method Detail

      • runServer

        public void runServer()
               throws RuntimeException
        Starts server.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - thrown on fatal configuration errors.

        Stops server.
